hints.content: Start by understanding what a subarray is. A subarray is a contiguous portion of an array. For this problem, you need to focus on subarrays of length 2.
Consider how you can calculate the sum of each subarray of length 2. For an array `nums`, the sum of the subarray starting at index `i` can be calculated as `nums[i] + nums[i+1]`.
Think about the constraints of the problem. You need to check if there are two subarrays of length 2 that have the same sum, and they must start at different indices.
You can use a loop to iterate through the array and calculate the sum for each subarray of length 2. Remember that you can only go up to `len(nums) - 2` to avoid going out of bounds.
As you calculate the sums, consider storing them in a data structure. A set is a good choice because it allows for quick lookups and can help you identify duplicates easily.
When you calculate the sum of a subarray, check if that sum already exists in your set. If it does, you have found two subarrays with the same sum.
Make sure to handle edge cases where the array has the minimum length of 2. In this case, there can only be one subarray, so the answer would be false.
Remember that the sums must be from different starting indices. So, if you find a sum that exists in your set, ensure that the indices of the subarrays are indeed different.
Consider the case where the elements in the array are negative or zero. The logic remains the same, but ensure your sum calculations handle all integer values correctly.
Finally, if you reach the end of your loop without finding any duplicate sums, return false. Otherwise, return true as soon as you find a match.

questionNotes: Subarrays must start at different indices.
Return true if such subarrays exist, otherwise return false.
